<li id="cite_note-rice19850415-36"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-rice19850415_36-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-rice19850415_36-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite id="CITEREFRice1985" class="citation news cs1">Rice, Valerie (April 15, 1985). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=zC4EAAAAMBAJ&amp;pg=PA35">"Unrecognized Apple II Employees Exit"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/InfoWorld" title="InfoWorld">InfoWorld</a></i>. p.&#160;35. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20230301054845/https://books.google.com/books?id=zC4EAAAAMBAJ&amp;pg=PA35">Archived</a> from the original on March 1, 2023<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-IsProgramingObsolete-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-IsProgramingObsolete_37-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite id="CITEREFHarvey1994" class="citation web cs1">Harvey, Brian (1994). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131005000323/http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/~bh/obsolete.html">"Is Programing Obsolete?"</a>. Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences, <a href="/wiki/University_of_California,_Berkeley" title="University of California, Berkeley">University of California, Berkeley</a>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/~bh/obsolete.html">the original</a> on October 5, 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">June 14,</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Is+Programing+Obsolete%3F&amp;rft.pub=Electrical+Engineering+and+Computer+Sciences%2C+University+of+California%2C+Berkeley&amp;rft.date=1994&amp;rft.aulast=Harvey&amp;rft.aufirst=Brian&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.eecs.berkeley.edu%2F~bh%2Fobsolete.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AApple+Inc." class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-insidestoryCarlton-54"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-insidestoryCarlton_54-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-insidestoryCarlton_54-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite id="CITEREFCarlton1997" class="citation book cs1">Carlton, Jim (1997). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/appleinsidestory00carl"><i>Apple: The inside story of intrigue, egomania, and business blunders</i></a>. </li>

<li id="cite_note-225"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-225">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite id="CITEREFGreenberg2016" class="citation journal cs1">Greenberg, Andy (June 13, 2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.wired.com/2016/06/apples-differential-privacy-collecting-data">"Apple's 'differential privacy' is about collecting your data – but not <i>your</i> data"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Wired_(website)" class="mw-redirect" title="Wired (website)">Wired</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20171213210548/https://www.wired.com/2016/06/apples-differential-privacy-collecting-data/">Archived</a> from the original on December 13, 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-233"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-233">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite id="CITEREFWhittaker2019" class="citation web cs1">Whittaker, Zack (December 5, 2019). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/12/05/apple-ultra-wideband-newer-iphones-location/">"Apple says its ultra wideband technology is why newer iPhones appear to share location data, even when the setting is disabled"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/TechCrunch" title="TechCrunch">TechCrunch</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20240302163635/https://techcrunch.com/2019/12/05/apple-ultra-wideband-newer-iphones-location/">Archived</a> from the original on March 2, 2024<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-341"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-341">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite id="CITEREFCardwell2016" class="citation news cs1">Cardwell, Diane (August 23, 2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/24/business/energy-environment/as-energy-use-rises-corporations-turn-to-their-own-green-utility-sources.html">"Apple Becomes a Green Energy Supplier, With Itself as Customer"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161129164413/http://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/24/business/energy-environment/as-energy-use-rises-corporations-turn-to-their-own-green-utility-sources.html">Archived</a> from the original on November 29, 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">December 30,</span> 2016</span>. <q>clean power often does not flow directly to their facilities. They typically buy the renewable energy in amounts to match what they draw from the grid. They're actually getting power from their local utility, which may be coal</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Apple+Becomes+a+Green+Energy+Supplier%2C+With+Itself+as+Customer&amp;rft.date=2016-08-23&amp;rft.aulast=Cardwell&amp;rft.aufirst=Diane&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2016%2F08%2F24%2Fbusiness%2Fenergy-environment%2Fas-energy-use-rises-corporations-turn-to-their-own-green-utility-sources.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AApple+Inc." class="Z3988"></span>; <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite id="CITEREFCole2015" class="citation web cs1">Cole, Nicki Lisa (August 5, 2015). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.truth-out.org/news/item/32208-why-is-apple-lying-about-powering-its-data-centers-with-renewable-energy">"Why Is Apple Lying About Powering Its Data Centers With Renewable Energy?"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Truthout" title="Truthout">Truthout</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160630060630/http://www.truth-out.org/news/item/32208-why-is-apple-lying-about-powering-its-data-centers-with-renewable-energy">Archived</a> from the original on June 30, 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">December 30,</span> 2016</span>. <q>Apple buys renewable energy certificates to offset its reliance on Duke's dirty energy. ..purchasing offsets is not the same as actually powering something with renewable energy</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Truthout&amp;rft.atitle=Why+Is+Apple+Lying+About+Powering+Its+Data+Centers+With+Renewable+Energy%3F&amp;rft.date=2015-08-05&amp;rft.aulast=Cole&amp;rft.aufirst=Nicki+Lisa&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.truth-out.org%2Fnews%2Fitem%2F32208-why-is-apple-lying-about-powering-its-data-centers-with-renewable-energy&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AApple+Inc." class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-reuters3-399"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-reuters3_399-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1215172403"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE6A41M920101105">"Foxconn worker plunges to death at China plant: report"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Reuters" title="Reuters">Reuters</a></i>. 				</div>
			</main>
